name: NYCDPR Safety Boiler
description:
Annual compliance filings for high and low pressure boilers installed in buildings.

The Department of Buildings’ Boiler Unit oversees the installation and operation of New York City’s boilers. Property owners are responsible for ensuring that their boilers operate safely and are in compliance with the Building Code and all related regulations.

columns.description: The tracking number for the boiler compliance filing.
The identification number for the Boiler. It's a combination of the Borough code, the DOB device number, the multiple dwelling flag, and the serial number.

The type of compliance filing.     Expected values:
• Initial = the initial boiler compliance filing for this device in this inspection cycle
• Subsequent = a subsequent filing is submitted to correct defects on a previous filing.
First name of the person who filed the application
Last name of the person who filed the application.

The license type that the applicant used to file the application.

Expected values:
• BB = Insurance Agency Inspector Certified by NYS
• E = High Pressure Boiler Operator
• O = Oil Burner Installer
• P = Master Plumber
The type of boiler: either low or high pressure.

Low pressure boilers only require an external inspection. High pressure boilers require both an external and an internal inspection.


Expected values:
• Internal = inspection by DOB staff
• External = inspection performed by an inspector hired by the building owner.
Date that the boiler was inspected. Date in ISO 8601 format

This indicates if any defects were found during the inspection. Expected values:
• true = Defects were found
• false = Defects were not found
Work Flow Status for the life cycle of the filing. Expected Values: Pre-Filing, QA Review, Rejected, Accepted
